author: Deena Coster
title: Former caregiver stole $10k from 85-year-old victim
text:
Former caregiver stole $10k from 85-year-old victim DEENA COSTER Last updated 11:48, February 15 2017 KATRINA TANIRAU/FAIRFAX NZ 
An 85-year-old South Taranaki woman had $10,000 taken from her bank account by a former caregiver. 
A woman stole $10,000 from an 85-year-old woman she was meant to be looking after. 
Linda Mary Smith, of Hawera, previously pleaded guilty to a charge of using a bank card without the permission of the victim. 
Between October 2015 and June 2016, Smith used the card 28 times to make cash withdrawals from the victim's account. Supplied 
A Hawera woman was sentenced to community detention and community work after she used an 85-year-old woman's bank card 28 times without permission. 
It was offending defence lawyer Rajan Rai said Smith was deeply remorseful about. 
"She acknowledges she had abused the trust which had been placed in her," he said.

In total, Smith took $10,230 from the victim, who she had helped to look after for about three years. 
Rai told the Hawera District Court on Wednesday that when confronted by police about offending, she made a full admission. She had also fronted up to the victim's family at a restorative justice meeting. 
He said said the theft had been motivated by Smith's failing business venture. 
"She has taken the money to try and keep that business float," he said. 
At the time she was also coping with the death of her father, who had also been helping her manage her financial problems. 
"She then lost the ability to behave rationally," he said. 
To date, Smith had paid back $130 of the stolen money, Rai said. 
Judge Chris Sygrove said it appeared Smith's life went into a "downward spiral" following the failure of her business and the death of her father. 
"You admitted you couldn't cope anymore," Sygrove said, before adding that this was no excuse for what she had done. 
Smith was sentenced to a four month term of community detention and was ordered to complete 100 hours of community work. 
A reparation order for $10,230 was also imposed. - Stuff
